Explanation: The bug in the buggy code is that it does not handle the case when the string length is 0. In this case, it should return '@@' but it throws an exception. Also, when the string length is 1, it should return the character followed by '@', but it only returns the character. Generated Test cases 1-8 should pass the buggy code as they have string length greater than or equal to 2. Test cases 9 and 10 should fail the buggy code as they have string length less than 2.
